div.bibl: Illinois Staats Zeitung, (Der Westen), February 8, 1914. THE CATHOLICS THE PRIEST OF THE HEART OF JESUS - PARISH, REV. EMMERICH WEBER DEPARTS FROM LIFE.

body.p: On January 26, Rev. E. Weber, the Priest of the Heart of Jesus parish died after a long illness. How popular and esteemed the deceased was, was proved by the enormous attendance at his funeral, which took place last Friday. His entire flock and numerous friends wanted to pay last honors to the faithful minister.
LIFE HISTORY OF REV. E. WEBER.

The Rev. E. Weber was born August 24, 1850, in Trier, Germany. He studied at the American College in Muenster, Westphalia. The priest consecration was received on May 31, 1874, in Muenster, and he came then to America, where he joined the Arch-Diocese of Chicago. His first domain was Dixon, Illinois, then Rockford, and next Libertyville. He was entrusted with the foundation of the St. Paul's parish in this city and a further domain was Elizabeth (Hanover Co.)
In January 1904, he was called to the Heart of Jesus parish, as successor to the Rev. Dr. A. Wolfgarten.
